G'day Rich - 

My opinions are based largely on "gut feeling" when seeing t=
he guard since, on photographs at least, these groups do resemble each othe=
r. Having the tsuba in-hand would of course make for a stronger argument fo=
r (or against) the groups mentioned, I would think. 

Maybe I shouldn't had=
 called the edge treatment "bones" but it would be the lines visiable from =
the three-fold construction of Akasaka. Last year I purchased a wonderful "=
willow tree" iron sukashi tsuba, mumei--one of my "dream" tsuba ever since =
Sasano illustrated this motif in his sukashi tsuba book. I felt it was Akas=
aka and it did have these linear lines (bones?) in its edge. Jim Gilbert an=
d Henrik Eschbaum
